data.title: Historical Events in August 1925
data.meta_description: Historical events in August 1925. Learn about 27 famous, scandalous and important events that happened in Aug 1925 or search by date or keyword.
data.text:
Shortwave-radio link between Kootwijk and Netherland East-Indies

Last US troops leave Nicaragua (there since 1912)

1st Dutch government of Prime Minister Hendrikus Colijn forms

Aug 4 US marines leave Nicaragua after 13-year occupation

Plaid Cymru is formed with the aim of disseminating knowledge of the Welsh language, which is in danger of dying out

League of Nation advises against Turk/Iraqi division of Mosoelgebied

1st national march of Ku Klux Klan (between 25,000 and 40,000 marchers) in Washington, D.C.

Ruth's Only Pinch-hit

Only time Babe Ruth pinch-hit for, Bobby Veach flies out

Hurricane strikes Borculo, 4 die

KMA-AM in Shenandoah IA begins radio transmissions

Aug 12 The first cast of Alpha Psi Omega, drawn from The Masquers of Fairmont College, West Virginia, is initiated.

Aug 12 The tariff law comes into force in Germany, setting up tariffs for industry and agriculture based on pre-war rates.

Moccasin Powerhouse along the Hetch Hetchy aqueduct in California is completed

Aug 14 Mount Rushmore Monument first proposed

Norway annexes Spitsbergen

Aug 15 White Sox Dickie Kerr, 1st appearance since winning 2 world series games in 1919

Belgium & US sign treaty about war debts

Aug 18 Cardinal Mercier warns Belgians against socialism/liberalism

WJR-AM in Detroit MI begins radio transmissions

Dutch football club FC Emmen is formed in the town of Emmen in north-eastern province of Drenthe in the Netherlands

US National Women's Championship

US National Championship Women's Tennis, Forest Hills, NY: Helen Wills Moody beats Kitty McKane of England 3-6, 6-0, 6-2 for her third straight US singles title

Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters organizes (Harlem NY)

Aug 25 Last Belgian troops vacate Duisburg

Meteorite falls on Ellemeet, Schouwen, Devil Island

After a night on the town, Babe Ruth shows up late for batting practice Miller Huggins suspends Ruth & slaps a $5,000 fine on him

6th Iron pilgrim at Diksmuide Belgium

Mead Arrives in Samoa

Anthropologist Margaret Mead first arrives in Samoa
